item.title: Fortnite: Jade & the Mask Story Quests Guide
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Speak to Kendo About Daigo's Use of Dark Magic
  • Look Into the Portal to Find Jade
  • Locate Daigo's Underground Hidden Workshop
  • Investigate Daigo's Hidden Workshop
  • Collect a Fire Oni Mask or a Void Oni Mask
  • Decide to Use the Mask or Rid Yourself of It
  • Return to Kendo

Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 1 story is all about hunters chasing down the mysterious demons that appeared on the Battle Royale map. These creatures made their way onto the island through portals that spawned on several named locations and landmarks, and it's up to players to investigate what happened and get to the bottom of it.

The second set of Fortnite Story Quests is called Jade & the Mask , and gamers will get access to them once they've completed Kendo's Calling Story Quests. This guide will help gamers complete the six quests made available this week so they can proceed with the rest of the story.

How to Complete Jade & the Mask Story Quests in Fortnite

There are six stages to complete in order to finish the Jade & the Mask questline.

Speak to Kendo About Daigo's Use of Dark Magic

How to Speak to Kendo in Fortnite

Similarly to Kendo's Calling Story Quests, gamers will have to talk to Kendo before being able to proceed with the rest of the tasks. Kendo can be found at Sakura Plunge , a small pond north of Nightshift Forest.

Look Into the Portal to Find Jade

How to Look Into the Portal in Fortnite

After talking to Kendo, gamers will want to approach the portal at Sakura Plunge. They mustn't get too close, as doing so will project them back, but if they keep a safe distance, they'll be able to investigate it .

Locate Daigo's Underground Hidden Workshop

Where to Find Daigo's Underground Workshop in Fortnite

Daigo's Underground Workshop is located in Masked Meadows. However, it is under a building and can be hard to find. Players can access Daigo's Underground Workshop in Fortnite by entering through the tunnel in the northwestern corner of the POI .

Once inside, they must take the stairs farther down and drop down onto lower platforms until they reach the workshop. It can be confusing down in the tunnels so here is a video to guide players in the right direction:

Above the workshop there is a mask that players can investigate for bonus XP.

Investigate Daigo's Hidden Workshop

How to Investigate Daigo's Hidden Workshop in Fortnite

Once players are inside Daigo's Workshop, they will notice that they can interact with various artifacts. They must investigate three items in the workshop to move on to the next quest.

Collect a Fire Oni Mask or a Void Oni Mask

How to Find Oni Masks in Fortnite

Fire and Void Oni Masks can be obtained by bringing Sprites to Shrines, opening Elemental chests and other containers, or defeating bosses and Demons. To learn more, check out our complete guide on Oni Mask locations in Fortnite .

There is a unique Oni Masks stand inside Daigo's Workshop, which contains one of each mask inside.

Decide to Use the Mask or Rid Yourself of It

How to Use or Get Rid of Oni Masks in Fortnite

This quest's description may sound confusing at first, but it's quite simple. To complete this quest, gamers must obtain an Oni Mask and then either use it or remove it from their inventory.

Return to Kendo

Once players have completed all of the quests above, they must return to Kendo at Sakura Plunge and talk to him once again. This will finish the Jade & the Mask questline and grant players access to the next phase of the Chapter 6 Season 1 Story Quests.

item.title: Don't Kill Rumble - Official Game Trailer
item.description: Don't Kill Rumble is an online multiplayer king of the hill battle royale game that is being developed by Scubalight Studios. Take a look at the official trailer here.

item.title: Infinity Nikki: How To Get Glimmering Scale (Sovereign of Cool Medal)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Get Glimmering Scale In Infinity Nikki
  • How To Get Sovereign of Cool Medal In Infinity Nikki
  • How To Beat Sovereign Of Cool In Infinity Nikki

Nikki got pulled to Miraland for interacting with a Miracle Outfit in Infinity Nikki . This is why it's her goal to find more Miracle Outfits as she journeys in the mysterious land. The first Miracle Outfit set that players will unlock is the Wishful Aurosa. However, getting inspiration for this set proves to be the easy part, as afterward, Stylists must collect the required materials to craft the outfit. Four of the materials needed for this can only be obtained through a series of styling challenges.

Here's how players can get the Glimmering Scale in Infinity Nikki after beating the Sovereign of Cool .

How To Get Glimmering Scale In Infinity Nikki

To get Glimmering Scale in Infinity Nikki , players must beat the Sovereign of Cool in a styling challenge and then exchange the Sovereign of Cool Medal to Dada. One Sovereign of Cool Medal grant two Glimmering Scales, enough to make two sets of the Wishful Aurosa outfit.

What Is Glimmering Scale For?

Glimmering Scale is a material used to craft the Vibrant Goldvines hair from the Wishful Aurosa outfit. Here are the full materials required for the hair:

  • Glimmering Scale x1
  • Bedrock Crystal: Command x10
  • Starlit Plum Essence x3
  • Foodie Bee x3
  • Floof Yarn x3
  • Thread of Purity x200

How To Get Sovereign of Cool Medal In Infinity Nikki

To get the Sovereign of Cool Medal in Infinity Nikki , players must beat the Sovereign of Cool in a styling challenge . Players can meet the Sovereign of Cool, Aderinna, after beating all the Stylists from the Golden Daisies, Ebony Scissors, and Beyond the Basics; and the Corlain brothers.

The Golden Daisies and Ebony Scissors factions are automatically discovered in the main quest, but to unlock Beyond the Basics group, players must find Pepsa location in Infinity Nikki . Beating Pepsa in a styling duel will unlock the referrer of Beyond the Basics, Visuno.

How To Beat Sovereign Of Cool In Infinity Nikki

To beat the Sovereign of Cool in Infinity Nikki , players have to prepare an outfit with the following tags: Cool, Fresh, Playful. 13k points are needed to defeat Aderrina, but scoring at least 30k is required for the Perfect rating.

Sovereign Of Cool Duel Rewards

Rating

Reward

Normal

Sovereign of Cool Medal: Wishfield

Average

Thread of Purity x100

Great

Diamonds x30

Perfect

Resonite Crystal x1

The best way to increase the duel score is by leveling up the outfit pieces . This can be done by going to the Glow Up section in the Pear-Pal menu. Additionally, upgrading Eureka by heading to the Eureka section also helps immensely.

Only the score of each outfit is considered in a duel challenge in Infinity Nikki . The aesthetics won't matter , so feel free to use whatever has the highest point without worrying if the pieces match each other or not.

Some of the viable outfit series for this challenge are:

  • Blossoming Stars
  • Moment Capturer
  • Forest's Fluttering
  • Shark Mirage
  • Rippling Serenity
  • Fully Charged
  • Floral Memory

For F2P players, they can craft the following individual rare pieces to help with their score:

  • Raging Bouldy (Cool - Playful)
  • Sunshade Wings (Cool - Playful)
  • Endless Hug (Cool - Fantasy)

Along with the following Cool items:

  • Clearsky Moon
  • Undersea Encounter
  • Blazing Scorch

And these Fresh clothing pieces:

  • Tangy Sweetness
  • Sunlit Wave
  • Sunburn Blockers
  • Pearly Bird

item.title: Best Games By MachineGames, Ranked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • MachineGames has established itself with engaging FPS games like the Wolfenstein series and the highly acclaimed Indiana Jones game.
  • Despite some shortcomings in games like Wolfenstein: Cyberpilot and Youngblood , the combat and gameplay experiences are still impressive.
  • The New Order set the stage for MachineGames' success, offering poignant stories, memorable characters, and high-octane combat in an unexpected Wolfenstein revival.

MachineGames hasn't operated in the video game industry for too long, so it's nice to see that this studio has carved out a name for itself in the industry with a suite of engaging first-person shooters. From bringing the Wolfenstein series back into the mainstream to developing the best Indiana Jones game ever made, the developer has come a long way.

Their partnership with Bethesda has been quite fruitful, even with a few stumbles here and there. Fans can only hope that this underrated video game developer enjoys the love and adoration it deserves, allowing them to deliver more action-packed video game experiences like these.

6 Wolfenstein: Cyberpilot

The Visuals And Presentation Are Top Notch If Nothing Else

A VR Wolfenstein game that is fine to play as long as people know what they're getting into, Cyberpilot is a decent experience that lets players man numerous mechanical constructs. The Panzerhund and Zitadelle make for impressive power fantasies, while the game also features a stealth segment in the spirit of the new Wolfenstein games.

However, Wolfenstein: Cyberpilot has some problems stemming from a repetitive gameplay loop and short runtime that may turn some players off of the experience. This is why players need to know what they're signing up for to enjoy this VR game to its fullest, and despite its problems.

5 Wolfenstein: Youngblood

The Combat Is Amazing, Even If The Other Aspects Of This Title Are A Letdown

Many people consider Wolfenstein: Youngblood to be the game that put a stop to the series' newfound momentum after a string of popular releases. While this is understandable to an extent, players must understand that Wolfenstein: Youngblood is still rife with impressive gameplay moments despite its story falling flat.

As one would expect from a MachineGames title, the gunplay is stellar and makes it a blast for players to clear stages, as long as they don't face enemies that are ridiculous bullet sponges. Playing this game in co-op enhances the experience and eliminates the problem of a buggy AI that can make gunfights somewhat grating to get through after a point.

4 Wolfenstein: The Old Blood

A No-Nonsense FPS That's Short, Sweet, And Satisfying

Given how complex and layered most of MachineGames' offerings are, it's easy to see why the simplicity of The Old Blood would be alluring to many. This game is a standalone expansion to The New Order that serves as a prequel story.

The game's focus on classic enemy encounters with a fair bit of stealth makes it a blast to play through for fans of great first-person shooters. The action is satisfying in every single firefight and highlights just how riveting the core combat loop of The Old Blood is, making it one of the most underrated Wolfenstein titles made by MachineGames that players can get their hands on.

3 Wolfenstein 2: The New Colossus

A Bombastic Chapter That Helps BJ Blazkowicz Shine Once Again

It was clear from the tone set by The New Colossus that MachineGames was riding high on the success of The New Order . The story-heavy approach of the game was a huge hit and compelled MachineGames to lean heavily towards dramatic cutscenes for better or for worse. It can almost feel overly gratuitous at times, especially with the inclusion of side missions that rehash levels for encounters that feel like they're padding the runtime instead of adding something meaningful to the experience.

However, there's no denying that The New Colossus is an excellent sequel where the gunplay is ramped up to the max. Going akimbo with dual shotguns and ripping apart enemy forces is a blast, and it helps that the game lets players mess around with various gadgets to make the gameplay more dynamic. While the hasty nature of the ending may catch some players by surprise, The New Colossus never fails to entertain players until the very end of its unforgettable campaign.

2 Wolfenstein: The New Order

A Surprisingly Riveting Package Consisting Of Great Combat And A Poignant Story

Most players didn't expect a Wolfenstein revival to be all that notable, only for MachineGames to surprise everyone with a stellar single-player FPS that boasted the high-octane shooting action players expected from a Wolfenstein game, along with a story that was surprisingly poignant. It's not a stretch to say that The New Order 's narrative and memorable characters took many people by surprise, as they played a part in the resistance meant to boot out the Nazi presence in this alternate-history title by any means necessary.

The game's incredible combat loop and beautiful cinematics elevated The New Order to new heights, turning it into a resounding success for MachineGames. It was a step in the right direction, and the developer made the most of this hype with subsequent releases before moving on to a different project.

1 Indiana Jones And The Great Circle

Came Out Of Nowhere To Establish Itself As One Of The Greatest Action-Adventure Games Ever Made

No one expected Indiana Jones and the Great Circle to come out of nowhere and become one of 2024's best games. It's clear that MachineGames had a great love for the source material, letting players experience the iconic introduction of Raiders of the Lost Ark first-hand before Indy embarks on a brand-new adventure fans have never seen before.

The freeform exploration and meaningful side content is something that players will adore, letting them contextualize the plot at their own pace as they raid tombs, defeat Nazis, and interact with numerous memorable characters along the way. Players who miss the glory days of Harrison Ford as Indiana Jones will love what The Great Circle brings to the table. The multi-faceted gameplay is a huge improvement over MachineGames' past offerings, establishing it as the best game made by this developer.

item.title: TES 6 Has Big Skyrim Shoes to Fill Regarding Its Approach to Endless Content
item.description:
When Skyrim made its debut, it came as a landmark sequel to a predecessor that had been out for five years at that point. Over a decade later, the gap which followed Oblivion has become comparatively small as the wait for The Elder Scrolls 6 still continues. A primary contributing factor to this longevity lies in the modding support that has allowed the community to sustain The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim 's success to this day, but matching that degree of viability as a platform will be a challenging prospect for Bethesda moving forward.

While little is known about the upcoming entry, it'll presumably be centered around the further expansion of the series' endless replayability. The Elder Scrolls 6 has the chance to embrace community content on the same level as Fallout or Starfield have in more recent years, but the technological expectations for the next TES will also likely be the most demanding in the studio's history so far.

Mod Support Has Helped Carry The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim Through Three Console Generations

A Decade of Community Enrichment Has Seen Skyrim Thrive

Although the contents of the base game are rather impressive for the time it was released, Skyrim 's modding scene has granted it an unprecedented lifecycle. Examples like The Forgotten City and Enderal: Forgotten Stories for The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim are such robust community-made offerings that they rival the scale of paid expansions, extending the playtime of the title far past its default quests. These are capable of everything from lore-friendly dives into Tamriel's deeper cuts to fully original worlds, reinventing the title for a multitude of experiences.

From Anniversary Edition to Special Edition , Skryim has been repackaged to successful results multiple times since 2011. Through the active scene of players that existed first and the later addition of Bethesda's Creation Club legitimizing the work of fans among console and PC players alike, the game has somehow stayed active after nearly 14 years. This has allowed Skyrim to outlive the previous games by a landslide:

Title

Release Year

Lifespan (Approximate)

The Elder Scrolls: Arena

1994

2 Years

The Elder Scrolls 2: Daggerfall

1996

6 Years

The Elder Scrolls 3: Morrowind

2002

4 Years

The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion

2006

5 Years

The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

2011

13+ Years

Living Up to Skyrim's Example Could See The Elder Scrolls 6 Last Another Decade

The Key Status of Mods in TES6 Will Require a Strong Base to Build Upon

If there's any hope of The Elder Scrolls 6 launching in 2025, it would theoretically face the daunting task of keeping interest for at least as long as Skyrim has managed to do. This would entail carrying the franchise name until the late 2030s, ideally under conditions which allow modders to be more ambitious than ever before. It's difficult to predict the pace at which the industry will progress with each new console milestone, but the prospect of it continuing the trend of slowing down into longer generations makes this expectation seem all the more probable.

The extent of Skyrim 's impact can be difficult to grasp due to its popularity, but the core systems that it established laid a powerful foundation which has allowed it to stay relevant. Although it has suffered from imperfections like obvious bugs since release, the dynamic approach to action RPG gameplay it brought to the table is quality enough to still hold up. TES6 would need to further evolve these elements if it hopes to have the same lasting impact, and these kinds of innovations have only become more difficult to achieve as competitors have caught up.

The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim 's Skywind remake mod of an older TES title is still being worked on, which serves as a display of the deep ties of the series to its modding community. If Bethesda hopes to make the next entry worthy of one day featuring a remake of Skyrim within its own framework, it will need a base game which is a sufficiently massive step-up from one of the most impactful RPGs of the past decade.
